item.title: Elden Ring: How To Get Blood Tax Ash Of War
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Find Blood Tax Ash of War in Elden Ring
  • Blood Tax Ash Of War Overview

Ashes of War in Elden Ring add special skills to your weapons, allowing you to perform unique feats besides the usual light and heavy attacks. All weapons come equipped with an Ash of War, and many weapons even allow you to replace their Ashes of War with the ones you find while out exploring.

Some of the interesting Ashes of War can also be found in optional areas, like the Ash of War: Blood Tax in Moghwyn Palace. Here’s how you can acquire this life-stealing Ash of War in Elden Ring .

Where To Find Blood Tax Ash of War in Elden Ring

You can find the Blood Tax Ash of War by eliminating a treasure scarab in a northeastern cave in the Moghwyn Palace . You can reach this location in two ways: acquire the Pureblood Knight’s Medal by completing a portion of White Mask Varre’s questline, or use the waygate in the Consecrated Snowfields.

Depending on what approach you take to reach Moghwyn’s Palace, you’ll start your hunt from two different Sites of Grace:

  • Dynasty Mausoleum Entrance : If you use the Pureblood Knight’s Medal to reach Moghwyn’s Palace, you’ll need to ride northwest through the blood pool to find the cave with treasure scarab.
  • Palace Approach Ledge-Road : If you used the waygate to reach Moghwyn’s Palace, you can ride a short distance north of Palace Approach Ledge-Road Site of Grace , and find the same cave to your east.

If you’re below level 90, the Moghwyn Palace can be an extremely challenging place to traverse, especially if you get caught up in a fight. The area is teeming with bloodborne Albanaurics, giant spectral skeletons, and giant crows .

However, if you’re quick enough, you can evade these enemies and collect the Blood Tax Ash of War from the treasure scarab .

Blood Tax Ash Of War Overview

When applied to a weapon, the Blood Tax Ash of War allows you to deal four quick stabs at an enemy , each strike dealing damage to the enemy while also recovering a portion of your HP .

The Blood Tax Ash of War can be applied to a variety of weapons, including:

  • Dagger
  • Katanas
  • Straight Swords
  • Greatswords
  • Light Greatswords
  • Twinblades
  • Thursting Swords
  • Heavy Thusting Swords
  • Spears
  • Great Spears
  • Halberds

Connecting all hits using the Blood Tax Ash of War regenerates a total of 140HP . If you prefer an aggressive playstyle, and use one of the above-listed weapon types, you can consider infusing the weapon with this Ash of War.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: All Brant Street Construction Site HIA Commemorative Coin Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • HIA Coin 1 - Luka
  • HIA Coin 2 - Ronnie
  • HIA Coin 3 - Kaede
  • HIA Coin 4 - Becky
  • HIA Coin 5 - Li
  • HIA Coin 6 - Gray
  • HIA Coin 7 - Ironhead
  • HIA Coin 8 - Kaidou
  • HIA Coin 9 - Yang
  • HIA Coin 10 - Jen

Zenless Zone Zero is a new Hoyoverse RPG which has been significantly more laid-back than its sister games, Genshin Impact . The gameplay is catered to more casual players and follows an interactive story style. Combat is also more lax as the game focuses more on completing commissions and puzzles.

There are a lot of ways players can earn rewards and one of them is through the HIA Commemorative Coins in the game. These coins can be then used to exchange for rewards from Sage in a Barrel. Once players have unlocked the Brant Street Construction Site area, they can head over and collect the available coins. There are a total of 10 coins in Zenless Zone Zero right now and here’s how to get them.

HIA Coin 1 - Luka

You can find Luka near the Junction Box in the morning . Interact with him and buy the HIA coin off him. There isn’t a set amount of Dennies so choose however much you want to spend on it.

HIA Coin 2 - Ronnie

Ronnie will be near the crates in the morning and after speaking with her, she will ask you to take a picture of Kousaka. You can find Kousaka towards the back of the construction site near the Junction Box. Take his picture and then talk to Ronnie again. She will give you the HIA Coin after.

HIA Coin 3 - Kaede

Kaede will be near one of the lifts in the morning towards the right of the construction site. After talking to her, speak to Cole, who will be standing directly opposite her . Then, head back to Kaede and she’ll give you the HIA Coin.

HIA Coin 4 - Becky

In the morning, you’ll find Becky will be near the Junction Box . Just interact with her and she’ll give you the HIA Coin once you’re done.

HIA Coin 5 - Li

Talk to Li near the forklift in the evening . He’ll be looking at a cement bag. After the dialogue, interact with the cement bag and then speak to Li again. He’ll give you the HIA Coin then.

HIA Coin 6 - Gray

Speak to Gray near the orange truck in the afternoon . Just speak to him and he’ll give you the HIA Coin.

HIA Coin 7 - Ironhead

In the afternoon , head near the forklift and find Ironhead looking at some cement bags . Just interact with him and he’ll give you the HIA Coin.

HIA Coin 8 - Kaidou

In the afternoon , find Kaidou on one of the raised platforms towards the left of Officer Mewmew. Speak to him and then go talk to Pepper, who will be seated in a corner behind you. Then, go back to Kaidou and speak to him again to receive the coin.

HIA Coin 9 - Yang

Speak to Yang near the excavator in the evening and then interact with the cement pipes in front of him to speak to the Sulking Builderboo. Once you get it to leave the pipe, just speak to it and it’ll give you the HIA Coin.

HIA Coin 10 - Jen

Find Jen near some crates beside the forklift in the evening . Then, head across to the cargo container where Kaishu is standing. Speak to him and he’ll give you the HIA Coin.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Current Banner, Next Banner, And Past Banners
item.description:
Quick Links

  • ZZZ Current Banners - Zenless Zone Zero
  • ZZZ Next Banners - Zenless Zone Zero
  • ZZZ Upcoming Banners - Zenless Zone Zero
  • ZZZ Banner History - Zenless Zone Zero

The banners in Zenless Zone Zero are called Signal Search, and it's split into four parts; Exclusive Channel, W-Engine Channel, Stable Channel (Star-Studded Cast), and Bangboo Channel. Exclusive Channel is the banner that features a limited S-Rank Agent, while the W-Engine is where players can get the signature weapon for the featured 5-star character. Meanwhile, Stable Channel and Bangboo Channel are standard banners in ZZZ , where the former contains S-Rank Agents and W-Engines, whereas the latter is exclusively for 4-star and 5-star Bangboos.

Players can get standard banner characters from the limited banner if they lose their 50/50 chance, so there are multiple ways to get Stable Channel characters. Proxies can also pick a character of their choice if they pull a total of 300 Signal Search in the Star-Studded Cast. Since the standard banners don't change, players may be interested in knowing the current, next, and past banners in the ZZZ limited banner instead. For that, you can check out this article for everything you want to know about Zenless Zone Zero limited Signal Search.

ZZZ Current Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

The Exclusive Channel on ZZZ currently features Ellen (Ice-Attack) from the Victoria Housekeeping faction. Her banner comes with the following A-Rank Agents:

  1. Anton (Electric-Attack) - Belobog Heavy Industries faction
  2. Soukaku (Ice-Support) - Section 6 faction

Version 1.0: July 4, 2024 – July 24, 2024 (Phase 1)

Ellen Featured Banner - Debut

Deep Sea Visitor W-Engine Banner

ZZZ Next Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

The next banner in Zenless Zone Zero 1.0 is Zhu Yuan (Ether-Attack) from the Criminal Investigation Special Response Team.

Version 1.0: July 24, 2024 – August 13, 2024 (Phase 2)

Zhu Yuan

Zhu Yuan W-Engine

ZZZ Upcoming Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

Zenless Zone Zero 1.1 teased two new upcoming characters, both from the Criminal Investigation Special Response Team, like Zhu Yuan; Qingyi, and Seth.

Version 1.1

Qingyi

Seth

ZZZ Banner History - Zenless Zone Zero

There's currently no banner history for ZZZ as the game is still in version 1.0.

item.title: Pokémon GO: How To Get Solar Fusion Energy & Lunar Fusion Energy Codes
item.description:
Pokémon GO is constantly adding events to keep players busy throughout the year. Fortunately, announcements are released ahead of these events to give you plenty of time to prepare and to ensure that you won't miss out on anything.

Go Fest Global 2024 is being hosted globally this summer by Pokémon GO and is said to be the largest event of the year. While it hasn't quite begun, there are ways that you can prepare for it to ensure that you get the most out of this highly anticipated event.

How To Get Solar Fusion Energy & Lunar Fusion Energy Codes

Pokémon GO ensures there are numerous ways players can be rewarded, such as with the Ultra Space timed research tasks. The Go Fest Global event is no different. Solar Fusion Energy and Lunar Fusion Energy are essential in getting the Dawn Wing forms and Necrozma's Dusk Mane in Pokémon GO.

You will also need to have acquired Necrozma and either Lunala or Solgalego and have the specific energy correlated with the Necrozma form you want to create with the Fusion. To perform the fusion, you will need 1,000 fusion energy, 30 Necrozma candy, and 30 Cosmog candy . You'll be able to obtain this energy during Go Fest Global, but there's also a way to get it for free prior to the event starting.

Once the fusion is completed, you can not undo it .

The Niantic developer announced in an Instagram promotion that they were giving away codes that will give you free Solar Fusion Energy and Lunar Fusion Energy on various days. The following are the codes that have been released so far, as well as the Pokémon GO site where you can redeem them.

It's unclear when these codes will expire, so it is suggested you redeem them as soon as possible.

  • July 9th: 100 Solar Fusion Energy - LFR5CWZ7852CP
  • July 10th : Lunar Solar Fusion Energy - TBA
  • July 11th: 100 Solar Fusion Energy - TBA
  • July 12th : Lunar Solar Fusion Energy - TBA

Obtaining Solar Fusion Energy & Lunar Fusion Energy

So far, there are three ways that you can obtain Solar Fusion Energy and Lunar Fusion Energ:

  • Complete the branching research, which is part of the paid Go Fest Global ticket during day 2, July 14. You will also get a special background when you get Solgaleo or Lunula.
  • If you defeat Dusk Mane Necrozma, you will receive Solar Fusion Energy, and if you defeat Dawn Wings Necrozma, you will receive Lunar Fusion Energy on Sunday, July 14th.
  • Redeem the released promo codes that are released prior to the event.

These three opportunities are on top of the fact that you should have received 1,000 Solar or Lunar Fusion energy if you completed the event-exclusive research. This, of course, depends on which path you decided to take during that research. It is unclear how much of this Fusion Energy you will be able to receive in total during this event.

Knowing the Necrozma Raid counters and weaknesses can help you in your endeavor.

item.title: Luigi's Mansion 2: What Does the Gold Bone Do?
item.description:
Luigi's Mansion 2 has Luigi once again hunting down ghosts on behalf of Professor E. Gadd. Armed with the Poltergust 5000 and a trusty flashlight, you'll explore five different mansions to gather the pieces of the shattered Dark Moon and restore peace to Evershade Valley.

There are a number of different treasures for Luigi to collect throughout Luigi's Mansion 2 . One type of treasure that is incredibly valuable is the Gold Bone, which doubles as an extra life in the event that Luigi runs out of health. Of course, you'll want to hang onto them until the end of each mission if you can, since they add 200G to your treasure count at the end of a mission if you don't use them.

How to Find Gold Bones

Gold Bones can be found inside empty drawers and furniture throughout the game, though they will only appear if Luigi has collected 200G of treasure already in the current mission. It seems that they are guaranteed to be found in the first object you check after reaching the 200G requirement. This can be useful to know when taking on some of the game's harder levels due to them functioning as extra lives.

What Do Gold Bones Do?

Gold Bones serve two purposes in Luigi's Mansion 2 . Firstly, they are worth 200G at the end of a mission if you don't use them, making them valuable for players seeking a higher treasure total. Their second use is attracting the Polterpup to provide assistance if Luigi runs out of health. Should Luigi run out of health while carrying a Gold Bone, the Polterpup will arrive and revive him, taking the Bone in exchange. Grabbing a Gold Bone as soon as possible during a mission can be an excellent safety net in case you run out of health facing off against some of the more dangerous ghosts. It also means getting to see more of the adorable Polterpup, which is always nice.
